name: impractically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that cannot be done or used easily or effectively, or that causes problems when used in a particular situation: He felt annoyed by her inability to focus, and by her impractically fancy boots. The equipment needed would be impractically expensive.
More examplesFewer examplesThey set up their large but impractically chilly tents.Traditional screening tests are impractically lengthy at 40 to 60 minutes.We suffer as a result of rules that are outdated, and that are inappropriately and impractically applied.
